title: 5 Quick Ways to Make the Heart Symbol Using a Computer

steps.title: Press Alt+3 on your number pad.
steps.content: Press Alt + 3 on your number pad. This is called an alt code, and this will only work on a numeric keypad (located in a separate section on the right of the keyboard, not at the top). Make sure you have NumLock enabled. This is indicated by a light on most keyboards. If you don't have a number pad, see the section on using emojis or the on-screen keyboard .

steps.title: Highlight the heart ♥ or ♡.
steps.content: Highlight the heart ♥ or ♡ . You can drag your cursor from the beginning of the heart to the end.

steps.title: Right-click the heart and select Copy.
steps.content: Right-click the heart and select Copy . On Mac, you'll need to control-click . You can also use the keyboard shortcut CTRL + C (Windows) or CMD + C (Mac) to copy. This will copy the heart to your computer's clipboard.

steps.title: Right-click another field and select Paste.
steps.content: Right-click another field and select Paste . On Mac, you'll need to control-click. You can also use the keyboard shortcut CTRL + V (Windows) or CMD + V (Mac) to paste. The heart will be pasted in the new field.

steps.title: Open a webpage or text app.
steps.content: Open a webpage or text app. You'll need a place where you can insert text, like Microsoft Word or Notepad .

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+.. This is the Windows key and period (.) key.[1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The Emoji keyboard will pop up.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + . . This is the Windows key and period (.) key. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The Emoji keyboard will pop up.

steps.title: Click the heart category.
steps.content: Click the heart category. This is at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Click a heart emoji.
steps.content: Click a heart emoji . You'll see all available heart colors. This will add the heart emoji immediately to the text field.

steps.title: Open a webpage or text app.
steps.content: Open a webpage or text app. You'll need a place where you can insert text, like Pages or TextEdit.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Cmd+Ctrl+Space.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Cmd + Ctrl + Space . The Emoji keyboard will pop up.

steps.title: Click Symbols.
steps.content: Click Symbols . This is in the second tab from the left. You can also type "heart" into the search field to find your options.

steps.title: Click a heart emoji.
steps.content: Click a heart emoji. You'll see all available heart colors. This will add the heart emoji immediately to the text field.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+Ctrl+O.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + Ctrl + O . This will open the on-screen keyboard for Windows.

steps.title: Enable the numeric keypad.
steps.content: Enable the numeric keypad. Click the Options key on the right side of the on-screen keyboard. Check the box for Turn on numeric keypad and click OK .

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . This is on the right side.

steps.title: Click NumLock.
steps.content: Click NumLock . The button should be highlighted blue. If it's already blue, skip this step.

steps.title: Click Alt+3.
steps.content: Click Alt + 3 . Use your mouse to click the Alt and 3 on the on-screen keyboard. This is the 3 on the numeric keypad on the right. The black heart (♥) will be typed.
